movesets.name: All-Out Attacker
movesets.description:
Moves

Sucker Punch is a strong priority STAB move, allowing Absol to become an excellent revenge killer. Knock Off is a very powerful and reliable STAB move that also strips the opponent of its item, which is incredibly useful. Fire Blast is a useful tool to hit Skarmory and Ferrothorn for immense damage. Ice Beam is also a good move to hit Landorus-T and Gliscor for large amounts of damage. However, Thunderbolt is a viable alternative over either, as it strikes Azumarill and Keldeo, who would otherwise wall this set. Superpower hits Heatran, Tyranitar, and Chansey very hard and is legal with Knock Off. Pursuit is a good move to damage any Pokemon that may try to switch out of Absol. Iron Tail could be used as an option to hit Clefable, Sylveon, and Togekiss for heavy damage, but its poor accuracy and otherwise mediocre coverage make it a lesser choice in general. Play Rough allows Absol to hit Fighting-types and Tyranitar and in general provides good coverage with Sucker Punch, but it is generally inferior to the moves above, which provide much more utility.

Set Details

A Naive nature is chosen to make effective use of Mega Absol's high Speed, while also allowing it to effectively utilize its Special Attack. 224 Speed EVs allow Mega Absol to outspeed Thundurus, while the remainder of the EVs are invested into its offensive stats. Justified is a good ability to allow Absol to switch into Dark-type moves, such as Knock Off, to receive a potential Attack boost to enhance its damage output once it gets going. Investing in Attack is preferred over Special Attack because its STAB moves, Sucker Punch and Knock Off, are the most important moves of this set. If running Pursuit, use a Jolly nature and dump the remaining EVs into HP or Speed.

Usage Tips

Mega Absol functions well as a revenge killer as well as a trapper. With Knock Off and Fire Blast, Mega Absol is also a good wallbreaker, being able to dismantle common defensive threat such as Skarmory and Chansey. Absol has limited switch-in opportunities, so it is best to try to come in on weak defensive threats such as Chansey or to use a slow U-turn or Volt Switch user such as Scizor to get Mega Absol in with ease. Mega Absol can also be used in the lead position to prevent leads such as Klefki from setting up entry hazards.

Team Options

Talonflame makes a good offensive partner, as it revenge kills Terrakion and Conkeldurr without much trouble. Fairy-types such as Clefable, Sylveon, and Togekiss also perform this function well and provide good synergy with Absol. Fighting-types such as Breloom and Terrakion benefit from Absol's ability to remove Latios and Gengar from play, while they handle Heatran and Tyranitar quite well in return. Azumarill is also useful to handle Mega Charizard X and bulky Ground-types. Stealth Rock users such as Heatran and Landorus-T are useful teammates, as Mega Absol needs Stealth Rock to ensure an OHKO on Thundurus. Kyurem-B is a good wallbreaker that can handle many of Mega Absol's checks and counters.

movesets.name: Swords Dance
movesets.description:
Moves

Absol finds many opportunities to use Swords Dance to boost its already massive Attack due to its ability to force out common Pokemon such as Victini, Blissey, and Sableye. Sucker Punch is Absol's main STAB move, as it deals massive damage to faster Pokemon. Knock Off is a more reliable STAB move, crippling Pokemon reliant on their item and having good coverage as well. Superpower is used to hit Dark- and Steel-types, such as Hydreigon and Krookodile lacking Choice Scarf, as well as Lucario, opposing Absol, and Empoleon.

Set Details

252 Speed EVs allow Absol to outspeed many non-Choice Scarfed threats, while 252 Attack EVs give Absol extra firepower, and 4 Special Defense EVs give Download users an unwelcome Attack boost. Absolite is vital, as regular Absol is not viable in UU. A Jolly nature is used to outspeed otherwise faster Pokemon, such as non-Choice Scarf variants of Mienshao and Froslass, which can switch in and OHKO Absol. You can use an Adamant nature for even more firepower, because Absol is already very fast and can use Sucker Punch to hit anything faster.

Usage Tips

While a Swords Dance-boosted Mega Absol is hard to stop, it finds priority quite threatening, so it is recommended that Mega Absol be used as a mid- or late-game sweeper, after its teammates have disposed of any priority users; or as a wallbreaker, taking advantage of its low defenses to cause massive damage, faint, and give a free switch-in to your sweeper or another teammate to finish the threat off.

Team Options

Mega Absol appreciates entry hazard support, as the extra damage assists it in picking off weakened walls. Forretress can set up on most walls that cause trouble for Absol, including Florges, Mega Aggron, and Aromatisse. Roserade also works well, as it can force out the aforementioned Fairy-types, cripple most switch-ins with Sleep Powder, and set up hazards with relative ease. Nidoking and Nidoqueen are excellent offensive partners to Absol, beating the Steel- and Fairy- types that check it and resisting Fighting- and Bug-type moves, while Absol destroys Psychic-types such as Cresselia. A bulky Volt Switch or U-Turn user, such as defensive Rotom-H, can take a hit from the opponent and immediately switch safely into Absol.

moves.name: Aerial Ace
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Assurance
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe takes damage in the same turn, before the attack hits.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Baton Pass
moves.description: User switches, but passes on all stat changes and some special conditions.

moves.name: Bite
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Blizzard
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Bounce
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn. 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Calm Mind
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Charge Beam
moves.description: 70% chance to boost Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Curse
moves.description: Does 1/4 of max HP damage per turn at the cost of half the user's max HP if the user is a Ghost. Boosts Attack and Defense and lowers Speed by 1 stage otherwise.

moves.name: Cut
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Detect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt. Only works if target is asleep.

moves.name: Echoed Voice
moves.description: Power increases when used consecutively.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: False Swipe
moves.description: Always leaves the foe with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Feint
moves.description: Only works if the foe uses Detect or Protect; nullifies effects of those moves.

moves.name: Feint Attack
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Fire Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Flamethrower
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.description: Uses the target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Fury Cutter
moves.description: Power doubles with each consecutive hit.

moves.name: Future Sight
moves.description: Deals damage at the end of the turn after three turns.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Hail
moves.description: Summons hail for 5 turns.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Hex
moves.description: Base Power doubles if target has a status ailment.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hone Claws
moves.description: Boosts Attack and accuracy one stage.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Ice Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Icy Wind
moves.description: Lowers foe's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Incinerate
moves.description: Removes the target's Berry.

moves.name: Iron Tail
moves.description: 30% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Leer
moves.description: Lowers target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Magic Coat
moves.description: Bounces back certain non-damaging moves.

moves.name: Me First
moves.description: Uses the foe's attack at 1.5x power. Must be faster to work.

moves.name: Mean Look
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Megahorn
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Night Slash
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Nightmare
moves.description: Does 1/4 of the target's max HP per turn to a sleeping target.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Perish Song
moves.description: All active Pokemon faint after 3 turns.

moves.name: Play Rough
moves.description: May lower the target's Attack stat by 1.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Psycho Cut
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Punishment
moves.description: Does more damage to foes with stat boosts.

moves.name: Pursuit
moves.description: Doubles in power if the target switches, and hits them before they can escape.

moves.name: Quick Attack
moves.description: The user always attacks first.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Razor Wind
moves.description: Charges up the first turn; attacks on the second turn. Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Retaliate
moves.description: Power doubles if the user's teammate fainted the previous turn.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Role Play
moves.description: Copies the foe's ability and overwrites the user's ability.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sandstorm
moves.description: Summons a sandstorm for 5 turns.

moves.name: Scratch
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shadow Claw
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Shock Wave
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Slash
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snarl
moves.description: Lowers target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.description: If certain moves are used, the user of Snatch uses the moves instead.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Spite
moves.description: Lowers the PP of the move used last by 1-5.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sucker Punch
moves.description: The user always moves first. Will only work if the foe attacked.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Superpower
moves.description: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Swords Dance
moves.description: Boosts Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Thunder
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.description: Paralyzes the foe.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Water Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Will-O-Wisp
moves.description: Burns the foe.

moves.name: Wish
moves.description: Heals 50% of max HP after 2 turns.

moves.name: X-Scissor
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

abilities.name: Justified
abilities.description: Raises Attack by one stage when hit by a Dark-type move.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Enemy attacks lose 1 extra PP. Increases wild encounter rate.

abilities.name: Super Luck
abilities.description: Critical hit rate increases one stage.
